Description: Rim sherd (with trace of body) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, twelve dilute lines between black bands; body glazed black; exterior: black line on top of rim, reserved below; part of ancient repair hole at right break.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile finds parallels with his Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.607.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.699) (Phase 3)
